description.narrative: Strengthened education system (evidence-based policy, planning, monitoring and evaluation) for equitable access and delivery of quality education

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 617/618 Diplomatic Drive Central Business District PMB 2851 Garki Abuja

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Nigeria United Nations Sustainable Development Partnership Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2016 Nigeria: Communication for development: an evaluation of UNICEF’s capacity and action
2017 Nigeria: INDEPENDENT EVALUATION OF UNICEF NIGERIA TRAINING INVESTMENTS
Nigeria 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Nigeria Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened education system (evidence-based policy, planning, monitoring and evaluation) for equitable access and delivery of quality education

description.narrative: Improved capacities of UNICEF's implementing partners in ten priority states on evidence based planning and generating reliable, disaggregated data to inform advocacy and equity focused programming. Basic education plans developed in 33 states with UNICEF technical support. 81 per cent of school-based management committees support by UNICEF met effectiveness criteria. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Primary school aged Out of school children in the reporting year accessing formal or non-formal education with support of UNICEF
e2c. EMIS that provides disaggregated data, including income/assets, disability and school physical environment - score (1-4), see guidance
a2b. Training and participation of community in using Education Management Information System findings - score (1-4), see guidance
